item.title: Cases in all of Germany
item.description: Data source: Our World In Data December 2, 2020: Our World In Data originally obtained their data from ECDC. They have since switched data source to John Hopkins, and the daily numbers looked different from ECDC/RKI, due to different ways of updating their data. Therefore I have switched data source to RKI which seems to be the primary source for ECDC. Cumulative number of confirmed SARS-CoV-2 cases in Germany in linear scale since March 15, 2020

item.title: Tracking the coronavirus outbreak in Germany from March 2020
item.description:
This is my attempt to visualize some SARS-CoV-2 data with some R code (please pardon the non-optimal layout). German data is obtained from the Robert Koch Institute. Data used from March 15, 2020 (not updated every day). For more extensive information about SARS-CoV-2 in Germany in English, see here.
Cumulative number of confirmed SARS-CoV-2 cases in Germany in linear scale since 100th case Number of confirmed cases shown in logarithmic scale For exponential growth, the amount of time cases increase from 100 to 1000 is roughly the same as the amount of time it goes from 1000 to 10000.

item.title: Covid-19 development in May
item.description: Questions regarding coronavirus It has been nearly 2 months since I started this website. I have been mostly staying at home, applying for jobs, and following the coronavirus pandemic development pretty closely. As of May 14, many countries in Europe have started to ease the lockdown measures. Countries with a lot of cases, such as Spain, Italy, France, Belgium etc. have since large drops in numbers of new cases and deaths per day.

item.title: Comparing Coronavirus Cases in the World
item.description:
Last modified: 2020-04-14. This is my attempt to visualize some SARS-CoV-2 data with some R code (please pardon the non-optimal layout). German data is obtained from ECDC. Data used from December 31, 2019-April 14, 2020 (not updated every day).
Doubling time for new cases and deaths I chose 10 countries to compare the rates of increase (in terms of doubling time) for the number of cases and the number of deaths, similar to the [NYT case growth rate visualization].

item.title: First post of the site
item.description: First Post Hello World! I have always wanted to learn make a webpage, but lacked time, focus, and interesting contents to place on the website. I am currently searching for employement, but due to the coronavirus SARS-Cov-2 outbreak, both the economy and I are undergoing a lockdown right now. What better time than now to teach myself some skills that will make me more employable when pandemic become under control and the economy goes into recovery!
